meanings.sent1: She lours when she doesn't get her way.
meanings.sent2: He always lours when he has to do chores.
meanings.sent3: The cat lours at the closed door, wanting to go outside.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds lours over the horizon, threatening rain.
meanings.sent5: His face lours with frustration as he struggles with the puzzle.

meanings.definition: To lower or darken in appearance
meanings.sent1: The sun lours behind the clouds, casting shadows.
meanings.sent2: The old painting lours with age, losing its vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: The room lours as the sun sets, creating a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The forest lours in the evening, becoming mysterious and quiet.
meanings.sent5: The sky lours as the storm approaches, turning gray and ominous.
